column4: I set up setupcon, but I must enter "setupcon" command every time I enter tty, to have my settings. I used setupcon --save, but nothing changed. WHat to do?
where it is, to change it globally?
what wireless chip does it use?
Prism, but the driver is all OK and working
is it usb based, or pci?
tried the p54pci driver in the default install?
you may need to install linux-firmware   you may need to run:    dmesg | grep -i firm     to see if there is a firmware missing, there is a NATIVE driver, so using the windows driver makes no sense..
I am using the native driver. It works. The problem is completely different.
I thought you said you'd used the windows driver?
I said I tried it and used ceni, and now installed native one, but normal network menager still thinks I want to use other program to manage it

I have no problems with driver, really, it works fine. :) I just want to change settings of the network-manager to allow it to manage, because I was using the different program to managing wlan1, and it thinks I still want to do it.
try wicd, it is more flexible and you can set the interface name, network manager seems to expect wlan0
